alert.note: Alert for Baldwin Peninsula and Selawik Valley; Chukchi Sea Coast; Eastern Norton Sound and Nulato Hills; Lower Kobuk and Noatak Valleys; Lower Koyukuk and Middle Yukon Valleys; Lower Yukon Valley; Northern and Interior Seward Peninsula; Southern Seward Peninsula Coast; St Lawrence Island and Bering Strait Coast; Upper Kobuk and Noatak Valleys; Upper Kuskokwim Valley; Yukon Delta (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued February 19 at 2:33PM AKST by NWS Fairbanks
info.description: ...Storms Expected Across Western Alaska This Week... A series of strong storms will move across the Bering Sea and impact western Alaska later this week. Gusty winds, blizzard conditions, heavy snow, and freezing rain are all possible. The best chance for freezing rain will be from the Yukon Delta to Anvik north to Unalakleet west to Nome. In addition, strong southwesterly winds may elevate water levels and cause water to rise up through cracks in the sea ice along the Bering Sea coast. The first storm is expected to arrive on Tuesday followed by a second, stronger storm on Wednesday into Thursday.
